column4: where can i get this "version of Slax called Frodo, without big applications, that fits in 41MB, or choose among the 200MB standard editions such as Killbill (which I use) or PopCorn."
can any one plssssssssss
unfortunately - we can only support ubuntu in here - does Slax not have a support channel?
5 GB for / and that being the only partition for ubuntu is probably a little low - you could easily run out of space
try.  sudo blkid
sudo blkid ""  bash: sudp: command not found
sudp ??
i'm not sure what you mean exactly - but i'll say yes
i mean to move over all my drives in my system using terminal can i?
hmm, again - that's quite ambiguous - what do you mean move all drives over?
ok, i see this - now what do you want to do?
i guess - but i can't tell which are for which ubuntu and whether or not the NTFS ones are for windows, but perhaps you do. ok, but go on
if you are speaking to me, put my name down so your messages are highlighted
you don't have to move the file over just to edit it - you can edit it under sudo with one of these commands.   sudo nano /path/to/the/other/xorg.conf
or if you prefer gedit.  gksudo gedit /path/to/that/xorg.conf
this command runs nano - but edits the xorg.conf on the other ubuntu - just make sure you give the right path name there
you don't need to - just run your editor under sudo
you don't need to take root access of the other ubuntu - all you need is root access on the ubuntu you are currently on.
did you use sudo??
you are not using sudo
well, you can't do that - you have to launch your editor under sudo or gksudo (to make the editor run under root)
alt+f2  .. then type  gksudo gedit
then file -> open , etc
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syslinux
